LanguageData.VGE_TargetingTerminalCanOnlyLinkWithGrav: Targeting terminal can only link with gravship artillery.
LanguageData.VGE_LinkWithTerminalDesc: Select a targeting terminal to link with. A targeting terminal is required to operate gravship artillery.
LanguageData.VGE_UnlinkWithTerminalDesc: Break the current link to a targeting terminal, allowing you to link with a different one.
LanguageData.VGE_SetWorldTargetDesc: Set the target on the world map for the gravship artillery to fire at. Shots fired over the world map are less accurate. Can only fire at revealed locations.
LanguageData.VGE_LinkWithTurretDesc: Select a turret to link with. This targeting terminal will be used to operate that turret.
LanguageData.VGE_UnlinkWithTurretDesc: Break the current link to a turret, allowing you to link with a different turret.
LanguageData.VGE_GravshipArtilleryNeedsVisibleMap: Gravship artillery needs to target a visible, explored map.
LanguageData.VGE_GravshipArtilleryInvalidFiringMode: Artillery cannot fire in this direction.
LanguageData.VGE_GravshipArtilleryInvalidGroundToSpac: Artillery cannot fire from planet to space.
LanguageData.VGE_GravshipArtilleryInvalidSpaceToSpace: Artillery cannot fire from space to space.
LanguageData.VGE_GravshipArtilleryInvalidSpaceToGroun: Artillery cannot fire from space to ground.
LanguageData.VGE_GravshipArtilleryInvalidGroundToGrou: Artillery cannot fire from ground to ground
LanguageData.VGE_ConfirmCrashLanding:
Landing on this location will be considered a crash. Any highlighted structures underneath the gravship will damage any structures on the gravship in corresponding locations.

The substructure may also become damaged and will need replacing before the next launch.

Some indestructible objects underneath may completely destroy the substructure and any objects on it.

Consider picking a different landing zone.
LanguageData.VGE_CrashLandingWarning: Landing on this location will be considered a crash and will damage the gravship.
LanguageData.VGE_CannotLandIndestructibleObstacles: Can’t land here due to indestructible obstacles present. Choose another landing location.
LanguageData.VGE_VacCheckpoint_SetVacuumResistanceDes: Set the percentage of vacuum resistance required to cross through this checkpoint. Colonists without sufficient vacuum resistance will not naturally path through this checkpoint. Does not affect drafted colonists.
LanguageData.VGE_VacCheckpoint_DisallowDrafted: Drafted colonists check for vacuum resistance
LanguageData.VGE_OxygenDrainIfActive: Oxygen drain per day (if active): {0} u³
LanguageData.VGE_OxygenReplenishOnOffDesc: This determines whether {PAWN_nameDef} will automatically replenish oxygen canisters when oxygen in {PAWN_possessive} equipment is below {MIN} u³.\n\nAutomatic oxygen replenishment is currently {ONOFF}.
LanguageData.VGE_OxygenReplenishOnOffNoWearerDesc: This determines whether the wearer will automatically replenish oxygen canisters when oxygen in their equipment is below {MIN} u³.\n\nAutomatic oxygen replenishment is currently {ONOFF}.
LanguageData.VGE_IneffectiveOxygenPackDesc: Someone is wearing an oxygen pack without any vacuum-protective apparel. The oxygen pack will not work. Consider equipping other vacuum-resistant apparel.\n\nColonists without vacuum-protective apparel:
LanguageData.VGE_EquippingIneffectiveOxygenPack: {PAWN} is equipping an oxygen pack without wearing vacuum resistant gear. {APPAREL_labelNoParenthesis} will not work.
LanguageData.VGE_EquippingOnOtherIneffectiveOxygenPac: {PAWN} is equipping an oxygen pack on {TARGET} without wearing vacuum resistant gear. {APPAREL_labelNoParenthesis} will not work.
LanguageData.VGE_RefillCannotCarryEnough: Cannot carry enough {AMMO_label} to refill 1 charge.
LanguageData.VGE_Alert_LowOxygenExplanation:
You are dangerously low on oxygen.

 Oxygen in storage: {0}u³
 Colonists and prisoners breathing oxygen: {1}

When oxygen runs out, the gravship will start filling with vacuum.
LanguageData.VGE_AbsorbGravheatDesc: Flush any remaining structural heat from the grav engine onto this gravheat absorber, allowing for an immediate gravship launch. Gravheat absorber will enter a long cooldown period during which it can't absorb any more heat.
LanguageData.VGE_GravheatAbsorberCoolingDown: Gravheat absorber is cooling down. Available in: {0}
LanguageData.VGE_LaunchGravAnchorCooldownInfo: However, landing in a location containing a grav anchor will completely remove the launch cooldown.
LanguageData.VGE_LaunchHeatsinkCooldownInfo: The heatsinks will reduce the launch cooldown time by {0}.
LanguageData.VGE_LaunchFuelAndHeatUnitsInfo: This launch will use {0} astrofuel and generate about {0} heat units, raising the temperature across the gravship.
LanguageData.VGE_MapDecisionText:
Your gravship has launched. You can now decide whether you want to keep the previous map around, or if you want to discard it.
If you keep it around, it will still be present as a colony map until you abandon it.
If you discard it, it may be replaced by an abandoned settlement, returned to its original owner, turned back into a special/quest location, or destroyed. Please note that keeping several maps open may affect your performance.
LanguageData.VGE_MapDecisionSettleText:
Your gravship has launched. You can now decide whether you want to settle the previous map.
If you settle it, it will still be present as a colony map until you abandon it.
If you decide to not settle it, the map will still be kept around until it is discarded automatically. It is currently kept around due to you having colonists in there, a shuttle or drop pods travelling there, or some special building present on the map. Please note that keeping several maps open may affect your performance.
LanguageData.VGE_RapidlyDeterioratingInSpace: Rapidly deteriorating due to the vacuum of space.
LanguageData.ConfirmGravEngineLaunch: Are you sure you want to launch?\n\nYou will be given a choice to keep the current map as well as anything not on gravship substructure, but if you choose to discard it, it will be permanently lost.
LanguageData.VGE_BuildSingleGravEngineOnly: You can't build {0} if you already have another grav engine.
LanguageData.VGE_BuildSingleGravEngineBuildBlueprintO: You can't build {0} if you already have another grav engine under construction.
LanguageData.VGE_InstallSingleGravEngineOnMap: You can't install {0} if there's another grav engine present nearby.
LanguageData.VGE_InstallSingleGravEngineBuildBlueprin: You can't install {0} if you already have another grav engine under construction nearby.
LanguageData.VGE_InstallSingleGravEngineInstallBluepr: You can't install {0} if there's another grav engine blueprint nearby.
LanguageData.VGE_GravshipLaunchCurrentlyActive: another gravship is currently preparing to launch
LanguageData.VGE_OrbitObjectsMultiplierDesc: By default the game will try to keep 3,8,12 or 20 locations in orbit (depending on globe coverage of the planet). With this slider you can apply a multiplier to this number, making your planet orbits super sparse or very cluttered!
LanguageData.VGE_CannotLaunchGravAnomaly: Can’t launch the gravship due to a gravitational anomaly
LanguageData.VGE_Alert_LowMaintenance_Desc: Some gravship components have low maintenance. This can result in negative launch outcomes and eventual break downs. Consider assigning a colonist to maintain them. Gravship components with low maintenance:\n\n {0}
LanguageData.VGE_SetDesiredMaintenanceDesc: Set the desired maintenance for all gravship components on this gravship. Colonists assigned to construction will maintain the structures if they fall below the set level.
LanguageData.VGE_NoGravtechProjectSelected: No gravtech research project selected. Launching will not yield any gravdata.
LanguageData.VGE_LaunchBoonChanceInfo: With the current predictions, there is a {0}% chance for a positive boon to happen.
LanguageData.VGE_LaunchBoonOutcomeChanceLetterExtra: Based on the gravship's launch, there was a {0_percentage} chance of a positive outcome.
LanguageData.VGE_GravdataStoredInfo: Stored gravdata will automatically be applied to the selected gravtech research project on next landing.
LanguageData.VGE_ConvertGravdataDesc: Convert stored gravdata into points towards the chosen non-gravtech research project. Conversion rate is one to one.
LanguageData.VGE_ConvertedGravdataToResearch: Converted {0} gravdata to research points for {1}.
LanguageData.VGE_EscapePodCrashDesc: A damaged escape pod has crashed on the map. It can be hacked open to reveal what's inside.
LanguageData.VGE_LaunchToOrbitDesc: Launch the gravship directly upwards and stabilize it in orbit. This is still considered a gravship journey and the grav engine will enter cooldown, potentially leaving you stranded in orbit.
LanguageData.VGE_ResourceProcessorInfo: {0} {1} production completes in: {2}\nRemaining production processes to complete: {3}
LanguageData.VGE_AstrofireInHomeAreaDesc: There is an astrofire in the home area.
LanguageData.VGE_RequiresSubstructureOrScaffolding: Requires substructure or scaffold to be build on.
LanguageData.VGE_ColorPickerValueTooltip: Choose a color by setting the color brightness.\n\nBrightness refers to "value" from HSV color model - hue, saturation, and value/brightness.
LanguageData.VGE_MustBePlacedInRangeOfGravSource: Must be placed in range of a grav engine or grav field amplifier.
LanguageData.GravEngineInspectedLetterContents:
Amongst the remnants of the crashed gravship, a still-intact gravjumper engine hums with energy.

It is possible to repair the substructure, but various components of the gravship are beyond saving. The engine pushes against gravity, levitating the ship and allowing long-distance travel. By travelling, you may unlock the technology that will give you an opportunity to rebuild these systems and more.

Launch a gravship by scaling it down, fixing damaged substructure and replacing damaged thrusters and astrofuel tanks. Refine more astrofuel in the biofuel refinery and select a gravtech research project to progress as you travel and stress the grav engine.

Launching a gravship will give you an option to abandon your current map.

 - Research project completed: Basic gravtech
 - Flooring unlocked: Gravship substructure
 - Wall unlocked: Gravship hull
 - Structures unlocked: Pilot cockpit, Gravjumper engine, Small thruster, Small astrofuel tank, Astrofuel pipe, Astrofuel valve, Astrofuel tap, Astrofuel drain, Grav field extender
 - Recipe unlocked: Make astrofuel from chemfuel
LanguageData.VGE_AgrocellSunLampDesc: Keeping the sun lamp on will make the agrocell produce light during the day, increasing power usage and allowing most plants to grow. However, disabling it allows for plants that require darkness to grow while saving some power at the same time.
LanguageData.VGE_MustTargetPilotConsole: This ability needs to target a pilot console.
LanguageData.VGE_RenameAsteroidDesc: Since {0} was the first to discover the {1} nearby, they get to name it.
LanguageData.VGE_GravtechNeedsGravdata: {0} needs gravdata to complete. Obtain gravdata by travelling with your gravship.
LanguageData.VGE_LetterTextMechanoidThreat: The mechhive's scanning process is close to determining your location. When it locates your {GRAVSHIP}, it will send a massive mechanoid force to kill you.\n\nGather your supplies, then flee the map by selecting the {CONSOLE}, and selecting launch.
